Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place for Chilling Out”
Reviews.Author: StephenMurray1981
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my girlfriend. Had a great time chilling out. Great facilities for the price - good mirrors for checking my guns out with a cheeky flex, loads of plug sockets so I could use my hair straighteners and electric body hair remover while listening to a bit of Jimmy Somerville. The gym was ok but it didn't have enough mirrors for checking my guns out with a cheeky flex, although it had an excellent ambience for yoga and meditation. Overall a solid choice (but not as solid as my guns).

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geem1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night as we were had a meeting at a venue nearby. It’s a very short distance from the Tetuan metro stop and just off quite a busy road with lots of shops and cafes. Despite being so close to a busy road, the area is very quiet and we slept with the window open all night without being disturbed. Although it’s not in the city centre you can get the metro directly to Sol by walking a short distance. If you’re staying a few days, buy a 10 trip ticket for the metro as this works out much cheaper. When we went it was 1 euro 50 per journey or you can get a 10 trip ticket for 12 euros. Our room had a small living room and kitchen with a separate bedroom and bathroom. The shower was fantastic and really refreshing after a long day out in Madrid! Breakfast was fairly standard and not included in the room price, but at 7 euros it’s not that bad for the convenience of being to eat in the hotel. It was a continental breakfast but there was a lot of choice. The real highlight of the place was the friendly staff who spoke excellent English and really seemed to go out of their way to be helpful. I would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: LunaRussa
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid for 6 nights with my boyfriend. We really liked the hotel. The apartment was big (way bigger than a normal room in a hotel) and clean. Very quiet in the night. The apartment is not in the center but the metro station is 2 min walking, and it's a direct line to Puerta del Sol (10 min). The room was cleaned every day, exactly like in a hotel. The people at the reception are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful and memorable experience + very good staff!”
Reviews.Author: KarishmaTawde
Reviews.Content: our first hotel on our Spain tour, it was an amazing experience. Its very clean, beautiful and has an extremely wonderful and helpful staff (which is a very good plus point especially if u r traveling with a child). its a great value for money option and is better than even some of the 4* hotels u come across in Spain.. only thing is - theres no porter.. so u have to carry all ur luggage by urself.. but all in all its a fantastic experience. The staff takes really good care of u at all times! Wonderful and memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great price - great service”
Reviews.Author: lfabregas
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference in Madrid, the conference hotel was Melia Castilla in the north part of Madrid. I decided to stay in a cheaper hotel to stay a couple of more days. IT WAS WORTH IT! The hotel was really an small apartment with kitchen, a living room and a good size room and bathroom. They have a fast wifii internet, and it was one block away to the Tetuan Metro station. The people was friendly and very helpful I absolutely recommend this wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: oglandercrew
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfy and spacious, good for families. We had two bedrooms, a cupboard kitchenette and good sized bathroom. The staff were helpful and friendly, recommending good places to eat nearby. On the downside, it's a little way from the tourist attractions of Madrid, but the metro is nearby, easy to use and cheap. Overall we thought the hotel was excellent value for money. Suspect you could be unlucky and get noisy neighbours, but our room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location as long as you don't want to feel a tourist”
Reviews.Author: joemdo91
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Europe and it couldn't have been better. There was a small countertop stove, a medium sized refrigerator, windows that open, nice bathroom, microwave/toaster, and all of the kitchenware you need. The neighborhood it is located in, Tetuan, is safe, especially on the major streets, and you see old people walking around loose bags casually even at night. It is a stone's throw from the metro stop which will take you anywhere in Madrid with free line to line transfers and there are plenty of grocery stores around (Opencor (open late), Mercadona, and smaller places that sell Frutos Secos, one is literally right in front of the hotel). If you're on a budget this is perfect, cook up some eggs, throw in some cheese and ham and toast some bread, buy juice or yogurt drink and you have a decent breakfast. Buy some cookies to snack on (rebuenas or Principe) and you can get away with only eating out once per day (or just cook some pasta for lunch or dinner.) Tv has like 50 channels some in German, French, couple in English bunch in Spanish. This shouldn't be important though! (well, I did watch the Europa League Final Porto v Sporting Braga). The front service is great, they even printed out a couple of bus tickets I needed when I asked where I could go to print something. Very polite and caring. I didn't test their English because I speak Spanish but I'm sure they know it if they're working in a hotel. Wifi code changes everyday, just call them from your room or go downstairs and they'll write it down for you. I read that some people complained about noise at night in other reviews but we were never bothered and slept like babies. Walls are sorta thin but it shouldn't be a major problem. All in all, I would recommend it to anyone and would stay there again without hesitation. I paid around $480 for 5 nights (no breakfast). PS unrelated: DONT GO TO THE ZOO ITS BORING AND A WASTE OF 20 EUROS PER PERSON!

Reviews.Title: “Good for work or study break - take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: DinahTate
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks while on a training course. The kitchenette saved me a lot of time and money as I didn't have to go out for evening meals, and the free wi-fi worked fine. The location is very convenient for the business area around Castellana. The bed was comfortable; odd that there was no main light in the bedroom, only bedside lights. The staff were helpful. Main negative point: people rolling wheelie-bins up and down the street in the early hours each night but this is a city centre so noise is inevitable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Roomy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GailAnnRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and well run. The rooms are very large. There is a sofa and table and 4 chairs in the kit/living room area. The kitchen is along one wall and has a fridge, stove, sink and microwave. There are no dishes or utensils or sponge. There is a sign that says you can ask for what you need. I don't know if there is a cost for dishes etc. The bedroom and bathroom are also roomy. We walked to the store, about 8 min. and bought breakfast and lunch food. We were very comfortable here. The Metro is very convenient and wonderful, but watch out for pickpockets when it is crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hrcnow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted plenty of space and because we aren't particularly bothered about hotel facilities such as swimming pools and bars. I would say this hotel is definately not luxurious but is clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate. We had an airy bedroom with a very comfortable bed, a clean bathroom with plenty of hot water and a living area with table, sofa, TV and small cooking area. They was also lots of wardrobe space: my boyfriend and I had a wardrobe each! We had to pay a deposit of 20 euros to get a key which unlocked the cupboard with the kitchen utensils, which stuck us a a bit daft. The TV was on the small side and we found ourselves with only CNN and Eurosport to watch, but since we'd come to see Madrid this didn't matter. The hotel was situated a metro ride out of the centre of Madrid, but it only took ten minutes to get the centre and the metros were cheap and frequent. It took less than 5 minutes to walk to the nearest station, Tetuan. There are bars, restaurants - mainly spanish or chinese-, (and, bizarely, lots of banks) near the hotel, but be prepared to speak Spanish, as we found few people spoke English ( not that they should have to - its just that, of all the capital cities we have visited, we've never had to use the native language so much!). The area around the hotel wasn't especially pretty, but it felt safe and there were plenty of shops and supermarkets.Madrid itself is nice but not "wow", although there is some outstanding artwork to be seen.

Reviews.Title: “well located friendly place”
Reviews.Author: mimisasab
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 5 days in February 2007 , my husband, myself and our 2 year old daughter. The location was great, not too far from a small supermarket, close to the metro (2 mn walk) and other shops. The apartment was basic but well equipped and the staff at reception very friendly (and patient when listening to us speaking Spanish !). You can hear noises from next door (thin wall) but really not a major problem. On our next visit to Madrid, we will stay there again as we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Galeon. It is clean and quiet and right on the subway line North of downtown. There are a couple of great bars around the corner and a good grocery store up the block. If you are coming from overseas, do not rely on electronic reservations. You need to call and cofirm your reservations. -Kelly

HotelInfo.Name: Aparthotel G3 Galeon
HotelInfo.Address: Francisco Medrano 4, 28020 Madrid, Spain
